{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient has amenorrhea and elevated levels of LH and FSH. This suggests that the problem is likely with the ovaries, not the pituitary gland, as the pituitary is producing more hormones in an attempt to stimulate the ovaries. The next step would be to check the function of the ovaries, which can be done by checking the serum estradiol levels.
